response.name: Beat
response.description: A returning character from the original Jet Set Radio. Beat is known for his iconic headphones and his love for street skating. He's the self-proclaimed leader of the GG's, a gang of rollerbladers who love to paint the streets of Tokyo-to.

response.name: Gum
response.description: Gum is a feisty girl with a talent for graffiti. She's often seen chewing bubblegum, hence her name. She's also a member of the GG's and one of the first characters to join up with Beat.

response.name: Corn
response.description: Originally known as 'Tab' in the Western release of the original Jet Set Radio, Corn is an easygoing skater with an artistic flair. He's a core member of the GG's and a reliable friend to his crew.

response.name: Yo-Yo
response.description: A mischievous skater with a reputation for being a bit of a trickster. Yo-Yo wears a characteristic beanie and goggles and is recognized for his swift moves and quick escapes.

response.name: Rhyth
response.description: She is known for her rhythmic skating and dancing moves. Rhyth joined the GG's and quickly became known for her sunny disposition and her propensity to break out into dance.

response.name: Cube
response.description: Cube is a tough, no-nonsense skater who values strength and resilience. Her attire is gothic-lolita-influenced, and she prefers to let her graffiti do the talking.

response.name: Combo
response.description: Combo is a large and in-charge skater hailing from Grind City. He's in search of the truth about what happened to his home turf and brings a heavy presence to the streets with his large frame and booming voice.

response.name: Professor K
response.description: Professor K is the enigmatic DJ of Jet Set Radio, the pirate radio station that broadcasts to all of Tokyo-to. He's not a skater, but he narrates your journey and gives the GG's the lowdown on rival gangs and the oppressive Rokkaku Police Force.
